Exceptionally Strong Warranty (ESW).reasoning: Exceptionally Strong Warranty (ESW) is a specific technique used in the research to influence consumer perceptions of quality, making it a methodological approach employed by the researchers.
passages: an unfamiliar brand can successfully use an Exceptionally Strong Warranty (ESW) as a quality signal under some conditions.
When used in an offer alone, ESW results in more favorable perceptions of quality than a weaker market-standard warranty

Third-Party Organization Endorsement (TP.reasoning: Third-Party Organization Endorsement (TPOE) is identified as a supporting trusted signal that enhances the effectiveness of the ESW for low knowledge consumers, representing a specific methodological approach.
passages: unless it is accompanied by a supporting trusted signal like Third-Party Organization Endorsement (TPOE).
the signal needs assistance from a naturally trusted signal like TPOE to be effective for low knowledge consumers
